Events
.entry-header
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
Riverwalk Signature Events
Downtown Parking and Transportation
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
, along with our charity, city, county and business partners, is pleased to provide a
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
to assist in planning your local entertainment.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
is the preeminent organization engaged in promoting Fort Lauderdale’s Downtown and the
Riverwalk Park
as a place to live, work and play. We provide this mission through organizing and hosting a wide range of fundraising events and other activations. We are pleased to partner with other organizations to promote and activate Riverwalk, Downtown and Greater Fort Lauderdale.
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar – Event Submissions
This calendar is for
events
(lasting one to several days, not on-going presentations or exhibits) occurring in Greater Fort Lauderdale, with other Broward County events evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
The event form must be completed in its entirety for approval
Submission Requirements
Your name/email – Required so the Riverwalk Team can contact you for more information; this is not included in your event posting.
Required image – For best appearance, crop your images into a square with a minimum of 200 pixels/maximum 700 pixels per side and maximum file size of 200kb.  Accepted file formats are: .gif, .jpg, .jpeg and .png.
Web addresses – MUST begin with “https://”
Phone numbers – preferred but not required.
Before submitting your event, please search the calendar to make sure that your event is not already posted.
The Riverwalk Team will post some events to the calendar.
Submissions will be posted following review
You will receive email confirmation after your event is approved, please allow minimum of 2 business days for approval.
Incomplete submissions will be delayed as our staff reaches out to you, and may be denied.
If you have any questions, please reach out to the
Calendar Manager
.

Events
.entry-header
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
Riverwalk Signature Events
Downtown Parking and Transportation
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
, along with our charity, city, county and business partners, is pleased to provide a
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
to assist in planning your local entertainment.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
is the preeminent organization engaged in promoting Fort Lauderdale’s Downtown and the
Riverwalk Park
as a place to live, work and play. We provide this mission through organizing and hosting a wide range of fundraising events and other activations. We are pleased to partner with other organizations to promote and activate Riverwalk, Downtown and Greater Fort Lauderdale.
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar – Event Submissions
This calendar is for
events
(lasting one to several days, not on-going presentations or exhibits) occurring in Greater Fort Lauderdale, with other Broward County events evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
The event form must be completed in its entirety for approval
Submission Requirements
Your name/email – Required so the Riverwalk Team can contact you for more information; this is not included in your event posting.
Required image – For best appearance, crop your images into a square with a minimum of 200 pixels/maximum 700 pixels per side and maximum file size of 200kb.  Accepted file formats are: .gif, .jpg, .jpeg and .png.
Web addresses – MUST begin with “https://”
Phone numbers – preferred but not required.
Before submitting your event, please search the calendar to make sure that your event is not already posted.
The Riverwalk Team will post some events to the calendar.
Submissions will be posted following review
You will receive email confirmation after your event is approved, please allow minimum of 2 business days for approval.
Incomplete submissions will be delayed as our staff reaches out to you, and may be denied.
If you have any questions, please reach out to the
Calendar Manager
.

About Us
.entry-header
Who is Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale?
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale is a
charitable nonprofit 501(c)(3)
organization responsible for the
planning, programming, beautification
and
promotion
of Riverwalk Park. We are composed primarily of
volunteer private citizens
and overseen by a board of directors. All members uphold the organization’s directive, as stated in its mission statement, “
to be the catalyst in building and nurturing Riverwalk and the Riverwalk District as a vibrant community connected by the New River
.” We pursue our mission through a wide range of
fundraising
and
membership
events
and
advocacy
on behalf of the Park and the district through our informative
website
and
GoRiverwalk magazine
and
social media
.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale has its origin with the
City of Fort Lauderdale
. In December 1988, only three years after securing funding for a linear public park along the New River, the City established
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
to facilitate in the design as well as develop fundraising and advocacy efforts. Since its launch, we have played a significant role in obtaining a “
regional park
” designation from Broward County; guiding redevelopment and Park expansion efforts; and contributing to the three most recent City plans for enhancing the downtown core.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
works closely with the City, the County,  the Downtown Development Authority of Fort Lauderdale, and other important partners in the public and private sectors in overseeing the development, activation and growth for our linear park and downtown Riverwalk District.   It is through these
partnerships
that we work to produce events and activities benefiting the Park and the city.
These events and activities have made Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale an invested participant in the growth of Fort Lauderdale and the Riverwalk District in Downtown.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale’s official magazine,
Go Riverwalk
, provides up to date information about
local happenings
in the city and downtown.  We lists all
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale events
and activities
as well as others
with 12 annual issues. More than 15,000 editions are distributed to members and subscribers and are available at up to 300 locations around the community.
Celebrating eighteen years in 2021
,
GO Riverwalk
Magazine
is recognized today as a standard in the community and
Fort Lauderdale’s City Magazine
with a comprehensive entertainment guide and business directory.
Celebrating over 30 years
, Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale continues to do a tremendous amount of work to heighten the profile of the linear park and our downtown.  We continue to
partner
with all of the
stakeholders
in the area and the
City of Fort Lauderdale
to improve the Park features for our community. In so doing,
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
has secured its own position as the preeminent organization engaged in promoting the downtown and the Park as a place to
live, work and play
.  We are a perfect destination!
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale’s Accomplishments:
2020: Installation the
Riverwalk 9/11 Monument
that displays an artifact from the World Trade Center in New York City.
2019:Installation of a playground in Sistrunk Park.
2015: Installation of four major pieces of Art in Public Spaces along the Riverwalk.
2015: Addition of a second 10-unit exercise station on the south side of the New River on Riverwalk at Smoker Park.
2015: Identification and implementation of the free
Riverwalk Water Trolley
.
2014: 10 New Exercise Stations  on the Riverwalk:
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
in conjunction with the
City of Fort Lauderdale
proudly hosted a ribbon cutting ceremony opening the new 10-unit exercise station on the north side of the New River on Riverwalk behind Huizenga Plaza.
Created and hosted
Light Up Lauderdale
(holiday decorations and lights on the Riverwalk) over the holiday season annually since 2007.
Launched
Tree Harmony,
a program to increase the tree canopy on the Riverwalk utilizing the “right tree – right place” concept of improvement.
Advocated for the
Riverwalk Public Realm Plan
and continues to be a primary stakeholder in that planning process and implementation process.
Click Here to Download Riverwalk 2020 – A Sustainability Framework
Launched
@Riverwalk
series of classes and mini-events along the Riverwalk to activate the park.
Joined in with the
Downtown Development Authority
and several condominiums in the Riverwalk area to hire an off duty police officer as part of a program to evaluate the need for
increased police presence
.
Hosted
successful Downtown events
such as the Riverwalk Burger Battle™, Riverwalk Get Downtown, Riverwalk Mutts and Martinis™, Riverwalk Tribute, Stone Crab & Seafood Festival, Boat Show Kick Off, Rocktoberfest, and partnered in Bus Loop, Food Truck rally to continue  activation. We also host
Membership and Power Mixers
and many other sponsored events throughout the year.
Created an information packed, downtown-centric, lifestyle oriented magazine,
Go Riverwalk
, that Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale continues to publish at no cost to our readers and which has now become
Fort Lauderdale’s City Magazine
and covering all of Fort Lauderdale! Celebrating 15 years!

About Us
.entry-header
Who is Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale?
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale is a
charitable nonprofit 501(c)(3)
organization responsible for the
planning, programming, beautification
and
promotion
of Riverwalk Park. We are composed primarily of
volunteer private citizens
and overseen by a board of directors. All members uphold the organization’s directive, as stated in its mission statement, “
to be the catalyst in building and nurturing Riverwalk and the Riverwalk District as a vibrant community connected by the New River
.” We pursue our mission through a wide range of
fundraising
and
membership
events
and
advocacy
on behalf of the Park and the district through our informative
website
and
GoRiverwalk magazine
and
social media
.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale has its origin with the
City of Fort Lauderdale
. In December 1988, only three years after securing funding for a linear public park along the New River, the City established
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
to facilitate in the design as well as develop fundraising and advocacy efforts. Since its launch, we have played a significant role in obtaining a “
regional park
” designation from Broward County; guiding redevelopment and Park expansion efforts; and contributing to the three most recent City plans for enhancing the downtown core.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
works closely with the City, the County,  the Downtown Development Authority of Fort Lauderdale, and other important partners in the public and private sectors in overseeing the development, activation and growth for our linear park and downtown Riverwalk District.   It is through these
partnerships
that we work to produce events and activities benefiting the Park and the city.
These events and activities have made Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale an invested participant in the growth of Fort Lauderdale and the Riverwalk District in Downtown.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale’s official magazine,
Go Riverwalk
, provides up to date information about
local happenings
in the city and downtown.  We lists all
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale events
and activities
as well as others
with 12 annual issues. More than 15,000 editions are distributed to members and subscribers and are available at up to 300 locations around the community.
Celebrating eighteen years in 2021
,
GO Riverwalk
Magazine
is recognized today as a standard in the community and
Fort Lauderdale’s City Magazine
with a comprehensive entertainment guide and business directory.
Celebrating over 30 years
, Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale continues to do a tremendous amount of work to heighten the profile of the linear park and our downtown.  We continue to
partner
with all of the
stakeholders
in the area and the
City of Fort Lauderdale
to improve the Park features for our community. In so doing,
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
has secured its own position as the preeminent organization engaged in promoting the downtown and the Park as a place to
live, work and play
.  We are a perfect destination!
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale’s Accomplishments:
2020: Installation the
Riverwalk 9/11 Monument
that displays an artifact from the World Trade Center in New York City.
2019:Installation of a playground in Sistrunk Park.
2015: Installation of four major pieces of Art in Public Spaces along the Riverwalk.
2015: Addition of a second 10-unit exercise station on the south side of the New River on Riverwalk at Smoker Park.
2015: Identification and implementation of the free
Riverwalk Water Trolley
.
2014: 10 New Exercise Stations  on the Riverwalk:
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
in conjunction with the
City of Fort Lauderdale
proudly hosted a ribbon cutting ceremony opening the new 10-unit exercise station on the north side of the New River on Riverwalk behind Huizenga Plaza.
Created and hosted
Light Up Lauderdale
(holiday decorations and lights on the Riverwalk) over the holiday season annually since 2007.
Launched
Tree Harmony,
a program to increase the tree canopy on the Riverwalk utilizing the “right tree – right place” concept of improvement.
Advocated for the
Riverwalk Public Realm Plan
and continues to be a primary stakeholder in that planning process and implementation process.
Click Here to Download Riverwalk 2020 – A Sustainability Framework
Launched
@Riverwalk
series of classes and mini-events along the Riverwalk to activate the park.
Joined in with the
Downtown Development Authority
and several condominiums in the Riverwalk area to hire an off duty police officer as part of a program to evaluate the need for
increased police presence
.
Hosted
successful Downtown events
such as the Riverwalk Burger Battle™, Riverwalk Get Downtown, Riverwalk Mutts and Martinis™, Riverwalk Tribute, Stone Crab & Seafood Festival, Boat Show Kick Off, Rocktoberfest, and partnered in Bus Loop, Food Truck rally to continue  activation. We also host
Membership and Power Mixers
and many other sponsored events throughout the year.
Created an information packed, downtown-centric, lifestyle oriented magazine,
Go Riverwalk
, that Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale continues to publish at no cost to our readers and which has now become
Fort Lauderdale’s City Magazine
and covering all of Fort Lauderdale! Celebrating 15 years!
Our
GClub
Team secured a matching grant from the
City of Fort Lauderdale
to provide for a potted plant enhancement project along the Riverwalk Park.
Provided a colorful
Banner Sponsorship
program along the Riverwalk Park.
Celebrating 30 plus years
of serving our downtown Fort Lauderdale community continuing to
support and advocate
for the growth and enhancement of
Riverwalk Linear Park and the Riverwalk District.
How can I get involved?
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale is working diligently on numerous projects to raise funds for Riverwalk improvements, activation  and to create a destination for the community and visitors. The dedicated group of members who make up Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
is constantly seeking the continued support
of merchants, government, businesses and local Fort Lauderdale and Broward County residents to help accomplish their goals. Get involved.
Contact Us!

Membership
.entry-header
Be part of building a vibrant Downtown Fort Lauderdale
Celebrating 35 years in 2023, Riverwalk has always been at the heart of building a vibrant and dynamic Downtown Fort Lauderdale, as part of our mission
“to be the catalyst in building and nurturing Riverwalk and the Riverwalk District as a vibrant community connected by the New River”.
From our advocacy for the Riverwalk as the center of a thriving downtown Riverwalk District, to our innovative events and opportunities to connect with neighbors, Riverwalk has something for everyone.
All Members Receive:
Monthly subscription to
Go Riverwalk,
Fort Lauderdale’s City Magazine
Recognition listing in
Go Riverwalk
magazine, on GoRiverwalk.com and social media

Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale Signature Events
.entry-header
Riverwalk has our own series of events that celebrate the Riverwalk District as a treasured place to Live, Work & Play.  Most of Riverwalk’s events are free and open to the public and held in Downtown Riverwalk District parks. The below list is not inclusive of all Riverwalk and/or partnered events.
*Date tentatively scheduled.
9th Annual Riverwalk Fall Festival
Saturday, October 18, 2025 • 12 pm – 4 pm
Esplanade Park
Downtown Day of the Dead
Saturday, November 1, 2025 •  3 pm – 11 pm
Esplanade Park/Riverwalk/SW 3rd Ave
Light Up Lauderdale (Get Lit)
Thursday, November 6, 2025 • 5:30 pm – 8:30 pm
Esplanade Park
5th Annual Riverwalk International Food Festival (RIFF)
Saturday, November 15, 2025 • 12 pm – 4 pm
Esplanade Park
Ellis Connects Riverwalk Holiday Lights Cruise
Monday, December 8, 2025 • 5 pm – 7 pm
Laura Ward Riverwalk Plaza
16th Annual Riverwalk Stone Crab & Seafood Festival
Saturday, January 3, 2026 • 11 am – 4 pm
Esplanade Park
10th Annual Riverwalk Chili Cook-off
Saturday, February 21, 2026 • 12 pm – 4 pm
Esplanade Park
19th Annual Riverwalk Mutts & Martinis
TM
Saturday, March 21, 2026 • Time TBD
Esplanade Park
Smoke on the Water BBQ Feast
Saturday, May 16, 2026 • Time TBD
Esplanade Park
4th Annual Riverwalk Tacos & Tequila Festival
Saturday, July 18, 2026 • Time TBD
Esplanade Park
Riverwalk Burger Battle
TM
– September 2026*
2026 will mark the return of the original South Florida Burger Battle, Riverwalk Burger Battle
TM
! Burger Battle is an opportunity for area restaurants to pull out all the stops and win bragging rights for the year.  A panel of judges will judge the entrants on a series of criteria, while attendees sample the burgers and select the “Fan Favorite”.
Burger Battle is a ticketed event with annual attendance of 400-800 with a VIP experience available.
Riverwalk Tribute – 2026 Date TBD
Riverwalk’s premier annual event, Riverwalk Tribute, honors community members that have made a significant contribution to Riverwalk and the City of Fort Lauderdale.  In an evening reception, Riverwalk members, community leaders and guests celebrate these leaders in our community.
The 25th Annual Riverwalk Tribute was held on Thursday, May 1, 2025 at the Riverside Hotel on Las Olas Blvd and honored:
Lisa Lutoff-Perlo, Melissa Milroy, Ed Smoker and Dean J. Trantalis, Esq.
Past honorees include:
Jim Ellis – Ellis Diversified
Kelley Shanley – Broward Center for the Performing Arts
Mike Jackson – AutoNation
Jorge Perez – The Related Group
Beverly Raphael Altman – RCC Associates
Crush Law – Courtney and Jason Crush
Bob Swindell – Greater Fort Lauderdale Alliance
Riverwalk Tribute is a ticketed event held at a local venue.  Tickets are included for some Riverwalk membership levels, and with all sponsorships. Annual attendance of 300-500 Riverwalk members and philanthropists as well as business, civic and government leaders.
Click here for more information on the Riverwalk Tribute.
Additional events
Riverwalk Member Events – Get Downtown and Power Mixers
Riverwalk holds a number of events annually for members to connect and celebrate the Riverwalk.  Get Downtown is held twice a year for the general membership in the spring and fall, while Power Mixers for Trustee members and above happen quarterly.
Riverwalk Rhythm & Brews – Quarterly
Held quarterly, Rhythm & Brews is a live music event, with cold brews from South Florida breweries, lawn games and amazing local food trucks!  All proceeds from this series directly benefit Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale, including all alcohol sales.
Rhythm & Brews regularly attracts between 1,500 and 3,000 attendees for a relaxed evening or afternoon in the Park.  Riverwalk Rhythm & Brews will be scheduled based on sponsors secured and partnerships with local breweries or other partners.
Other Events
Riverwalk holds additional events of our own, and partners with other organizations to build and support additional events.
Contact The Events Team
For information on Riverwalk’s events, including vendor and sponsor opportunities, and any other events information, please email
events@GoRiverwalk.com
or call (954) 468-1541.
.entry-content
.entry-footer

Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
Riverwalk Signature Events
Downtown Parking and Transportation
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
, along with our charity, city, county and business partners, is pleased to provide a
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
to assist in planning your local entertainment.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
is the preeminent organization engaged in promoting Fort Lauderdale’s Downtown and the
Riverwalk Park
as a place to live, work and play. We provide this mission through organizing and hosting a wide range of fundraising events and other activations. We are pleased to partner with other organizations to promote and activate Riverwalk, Downtown and Greater Fort Lauderdale.
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar – Event Submissions
This calendar is for
events
(lasting one to several days, not on-going presentations or exhibits) occurring in Greater Fort Lauderdale, with other Broward County events evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
The event form must be completed in its entirety for approval
Submission Requirements
Your name/email – Required so the Riverwalk Team can contact you for more information; this is not included in your event posting.
Required image – For best appearance, crop your images into a square with a minimum of 200 pixels/maximum 700 pixels per side and maximum file size of 200kb.  Accepted file formats are: .gif, .jpg, .jpeg and .png.
Web addresses – MUST begin with “https://”
Phone numbers – preferred but not required.
Before submitting your event, please search the calendar to make sure that your event is not already posted.
The Riverwalk Team will post some events to the calendar.
Submissions will be posted following review
You will receive email confirmation after your event is approved, please allow minimum of 2 business days for approval.
Incomplete submissions will be delayed as our staff reaches out to you, and may be denied.
If you have any questions, please reach out to the
Calendar Manager
.

Events
.entry-header
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
Riverwalk Signature Events
Downtown Parking and Transportation
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
, along with our charity, city, county and business partners, is pleased to provide a
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar
to assist in planning your local entertainment.
Riverwalk Fort Lauderdale
is the preeminent organization engaged in promoting Fort Lauderdale’s Downtown and the
Riverwalk Park
as a place to live, work and play. We provide this mission through organizing and hosting a wide range of fundraising events and other activations. We are pleased to partner with other organizations to promote and activate Riverwalk, Downtown and Greater Fort Lauderdale.
Greater Fort Lauderdale Event Calendar – Event Submissions
This calendar is for
events
(lasting one to several days, not on-going presentations or exhibits) occurring in Greater Fort Lauderdale, with other Broward County events evaluated on a case-by-case basis.
The event form must be completed in its entirety for approval
Submission Requirements
Your name/email – Required so the Riverwalk Team can contact you for more information; this is not included in your event posting.
Required image – For best appearance, crop your images into a square with a minimum of 200 pixels/maximum 700 pixels per side and maximum file size of 200kb.  Accepted file formats are: .gif, .jpg, .jpeg and .png.
Web addresses – MUST begin with “https://”
Phone numbers – preferred but not required.
Before submitting your event, please search the calendar to make sure that your event is not already posted.
The Riverwalk Team will post some events to the calendar.
Submissions will be posted following review
You will receive email confirmation after your event is approved, please allow minimum of 2 business days for approval.
Incomplete submissions will be delayed as our staff reaches out to you, and may be denied.
If you have any questions, please reach out to the
Calendar Manager
.

Membership
.entry-header
Be part of building a vibrant Downtown Fort Lauderdale
Celebrating 35 years in 2023, Riverwalk has always been at the heart of building a vibrant and dynamic Downtown Fort Lauderdale, as part of our mission
“to be the catalyst in building and nurturing Riverwalk and the Riverwalk District as a vibrant community connected by the New River”.
From our advocacy for the Riverwalk as the center of a thriving downtown Riverwalk District, to our innovative events and opportunities to connect with neighbors, Riverwalk has something for everyone.
All Members Receive:
Monthly subscription to
Go Riverwalk,
Fort Lauderdale’s City Magazine
Recognition listing in

magazine, on GoRiverwalk.com and social media
